newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: TAIWANESE SHIP ON FIRE OFF AUSTRALIA.
newsitem.headline: TAIWANESE SHIP ON FIRE OFF AUSTRALIA.

text.p: A fire was burning in the accommodation quarters of a Taiwanese ship anchored five km (three miles) off the Australian steel city of Port Kembla, a port official said on Thursday.
Port Kembla Port Corporation general manager Philip McGavin said there were no plans to abandon The Ming Mercy, an unloaded collier. He said it was unclear how many crew were on board.

"The crew is on board and carrying out emergency procedures," McGavin told Reuters. "A fire tug is alongside and a police launch and paramedics are on their way. But there are no reports of injuries."
The cause of the fire was unknown.
Port Kembla is around 100 km (62 miles) south of Sydney.
